clinical_study.brief_title: A Major Determinant for PICM and Its Clinical Outcome (PICM Syndrome)
clinical_study.official_title: A Major Determinant for Pacing-induced Cardiomyopathy (PICM) and Its Clinical Outcome (PICM Syndrome) : Prospective, Multicenter, Observational Cohort Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic right ventricular pacing has a deleterious effect on left ventricular (LV) function, namely pacing-induced cardiomyopathy (PICM). Pacing site, pacing burden, pre-implant LV dysfunction and QRS duration make difference of effect on the occurrence of PICM and its subsequent clinical outcomes. In particular, recognition of a major determinant for occurrence of PICM may lead to better identification of patients at high risk. Investigators prospectively enroll a participant with documented high risk of PICM and clinically follow-up to idenify clinical impact of PICM (PICM syndrome) over a long period of time.

primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of heart failure symptom, diagnosis and treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Atrial and Ventricular arrhythmia diagnosis, heart failure admisssion and all-caused mortality
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of atrial, ventricular arrhythmia, hear failure admission and all-cause mortality

biospec_descr.textblock: Investigators exam to identify a biomarker as a determinant for occurrence of PICM

study_pop.textblock: The study will enroll at least 500 device patients from multi-centers in order to identify and assess a determinant of PICM and its clinical outcomes (PICM syndrome)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: mandatory (1 and 2) and optional (3 or 4 or 5)
1. Willng to participate in the study and able to sign informed consent
2. Undertaken ECG and echocardiogram before and after device implantation
3. Above 115ms in the native QRS or 140ms in the paced QRS duration
4. Below preserved left ventricular dysfunction in the echocardiogram
5. Above 15% pacing-rhythm in the device interrogation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Less than 18 years of age
2. Being pregnant or plan to become pregnant
3. Advanced heart failure waiting in heart transplantation
4. Have a life expectancy of less than 1 year
